featured.text: After the band played an introduction, Wesla Whitfield wheeled herself onstage in a wheelchair.
For example, when the riders scan the band at the Off-Road Adventure, a photo will be taken and sent to their email.
Moreover, each visitor is offered the option to wear a GPS Adventure Band, which allows them to keep track of each other while in the park.
The Maasai are a semi-nomadic group in Kenya and northern Tanzania, wandering in bands and living almost entirely on the meat, blood, and milk of their herds.

other.text: Couples danced to music provided by a local amateur band or a record player.
Finally, football fans seem to love the half-time activities, the marching bands, and the pretty cheerleaders.

definition.zh_def: 一群人，通常是音樂家，合作演出音樂或表演。
definition.en_def: A group of people, typically musicians, who perform music together.
definition.example: The band played their new song at the concert.
